place.name: LITTLE EVERSDEN
place.gazetteerText: EVERSDEN (Little), a parish in Caxton district, Cambridge; contiguous to Great Eversden, midway between the Bedford and Cambridge and the Royston and Cambridge railways, 5½ miles SE by S of Caxton. Post town, Great Eversden, under Cambridge. Acres, 670. Real property, £1, 203. Pop., 239. Houses, 51. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Value, £188.* Patron, Queen's College, Cambridge. Charities, £56. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
